item.title: The Three Musketeers of the West
item.description: Tutti per uno... botte per tutti, internationally released as The Three Musketeers of the West, is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Bruno Corbucci.

item.title: Two Sergeants of General Custer
item.description: Two Sergeants of General Custer or I due sergenti del generale Custer is a 1965 Italian western comedy film directed by Giorgio Simonelli.

item.title: Centomila dollari per Ringo
item.description: 100.000 dollari per Ringo is a 1965 spaghetti western film directed by Alberto De Martino.

item.title: Kill Them All and Come Back Alone
item.description: Kill Them All and Come Back Alone is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Enzo G. Castellari. It stars American actors Chuck Connors and Frank Wolff, and features a film score by Francesco De Masi.

item.title: Four of the Apocalypse
item.description: Four of the Apocalypse is a 1975 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Lucio Fulci and starring Fabio Testi, Tomas Milian and Michael J. Pollard.

item.title: Los Pistoleros de Arizona
item.description: Five Thousand Dollars on One Ace is a 1964 Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Alfonso Balcázar, scored by Angelo Francesco Lavagnino and Don Powell, and starring Robert Woods, Fernando Sancho and Helmut Schmid.

item.title: Any Gun Can Play
item.description: Any Gun Can Play is a 1967 spaghetti western starring Gilbert Roland, Edd Byrnes and George Hilton. The film is directed by Enzo G. Castellari. The film is about a group of cowboys searching for gold, double-leading to double crosses as they continually change allegiances and get the upper hand only to be thwarted by fellow outlaws, mysterious insurance investigators and each other.

item.title: Two Mafiamen in the Far West
item.description: Two Mafiamen in the Far West is a 1964 Italian comedy western film directed by Giorgio Simonelli. Its stars Franco Franchi, Ciccio Ingrassia and Fernando Sancho.

item.title: For a Few Extra Dollars
item.description: For a Few Extra Dollars, also known as Fort Yuma Gold and Die Now, Pay Later, is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni.

item.title: Django Shoots First
item.description: Django Shoots First is an Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alberto De Martino.
